1.name: Cabiria
1.description: Three centuries before Christus. Young Cabiria is kidnapped by some pirates during one eruption of the Etna. She is sold as a slave in Carthage, and as she is just going to be sacrificed to...                See full summary »

2.name: The Spoilers
2.description: The first of many filmed adaptations of Rex Beach's adventure novel of the Alaskan gold-rush.

3.name: Tillie's Punctured Romance
3.description: A con man from the city dupes a wealthy country girl into marriage.

4.name: The Perils of Pauline
4.description: Young Pauline is left a lot of money when her wealthy uncle dies. However, her uncle's secretary has been named as her guardian until she marries, at which time she will officially take ...                See full summary »

5.name: The Squaw Man
5.description: A chivalrous British officer takes the blame for his cousin's embezzlement and journeys to the American West to start a new life on a cattle ranch.

6.name: His Majesty, the Scarecrow of Oz
6.description: A wicked king has taken over the Emerald City, and wants his daughter, Princess Gloria, to marry the horrid courtier Googly-Goo, though she loves Pon, the Gardener's Boy. The camera now ...                See full summary »

7.name: Judith of Bethulia
7.description: A religious woman seeks to save her people from destruction by seducing and murdering the enemy leader, but her plans get complicated once she falls for him.

8.name: Cinderella
8.description: Though mistreated by her cruel stepmother and stepsisters, Cinderella is able to attend the royal ball through the help of a fairy godmother.

10.name: In the Land of the Head Hunters
10.description: In 1911, as part of his massive undertaking, famed Northwest photographer Edward S. Curtis travelled to Vancouver Island, British Columbia, to visit the Kwakwaka'wakw. By the next year, ...                See full summary »

11.name: The Life of General Villa
11.description: The life and career of Panccho Villa from young man to revolutionary leader is chronicled.

12.name: Home, Sweet Home
12.description: John Howard Payne at his most miserable point in life, writes a song which becomes popular and inspires other people at some point in their lives.

14.name: Brewster's Millions
14.description: Robert Brewster, a scion of a well-to-do family, elopes with Louise Sedgewick. Peter Brewster disinherits Robert and refuses to be reconciled to the marriage, and later drives the young ...                See full summary »

15.name: The Virginian
15.description: A good-natured but chivalrous cowboy romances the local schoolmarm and leads the posse that brings a gang of rustlers, which includes his best friend, to justice.

16.name: The Avenging Conscience: or 'Thou Shalt Not Kill'
16.description: Prevented from dating his sweetheart by his uncle, a young man turns his thoughts to murder.

17.name: The Bargain
17.description: After the bandit Jim Stokes robs the stage he is wounded fleeing. Recuperating at a ranch, he falls in love with and marries the daughter. Now wishing to go straight he tries to return the ...                See full summary »

18.name: Det hemmelighedsfulde X
18.description: On the brink of war, Lt. van Hauen is summoned to take command of the cruiser, but due to unforeseen events, he is wrongfully convicted as a traitor.

19.name: Uncle Tom's Cabin
19.description: A black and white silent film based on Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel documenting the life and times of Uncle Tom.

20.name: A Florida Enchantment
20.description: A young woman discovers a seed that can make women act like men and men act like women. She decides to take one, then slips one to her maid and another to her fiancé. The fun begins.

21.name: Neptune's Daughter
21.description: The daughter of King Neptune determines to avenge the death of her sister, who was caught in a fishing net laid by the king of a country above the waves. However, she soon falls in love ...                See full summary »

22.name: The Exploits of Elaine
22.description: With the help of a private detective, Elaine tries to catch the masked criminal mastermind The Clutching Hand, who has murdered her father.

23.name: The Wishing Ring: An Idyll of Old England
23.description: After being expelled from college, Giles runs away from home and meets a young lady who he falls for.

24.name: Tess of the Storm Country
24.description: A wealthy resident attempts to dispossess squatters who live near his home, which leads to a false accusation of murder.

25.name: The Call of the North
25.description: Trader Ned Stewart's father Graehme was unjustly accused of adultery and killed. Ned sets out to avenge his father but is captured and send on "la longue traverse," the long journey to ...                See full summary »

26.name: The Wrath of the Gods
26.description: An American sailor falls in love with a fisherman's daughter and convinces her that Jesus is more powerful than the gods who have cursed her.

27.name: Lola
27.description: With the help of an electric ray machine a scientist brings back to life his daughter killed in a car crash but fails to revive her soul at the same time.

28.name: The Battle of the Sexes
28.description: Frank Andrews is a successful businessman. He has always found pride and joy in the company of his wife, son and daughter. He suddenly finds himself enthralled by the advances of a gay ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Escape
30.description: A dramatic comparison between the mating habits of animals and the way humans choose their own partners.

31.name: Damon and Pythias
31.description: After a prologue which shows several aerial views of the Acropolis, the story begins. The friendship of Damon, the senator, and Pythias, the soldier, is famous in Ancient Syracuse. Because ...                See full summary »

32.name: Fantômas contre Fantômas
32.description: The mystery of the drama is the appearance of the finger-print of a dead artist upon the neck of Princess Sonia Danidoff, whom Fantomas, as Nanteuil, relieves of her pearl necklace, and ...                See full summary »

33.name: In the Days of the Thundering Herd
33.description: Tom and Sally are the only survivors when their wagon train is attacked by Swift Wing's braves. Starlight aids in their escape and they join a group of hunters. But there is more trouble when the tribe attacks again.

35.name: The Stain
35.description: Stevens, the bank clerk, is ambitious. His great desire is to become a lawyer. He stays at the bank at night to study, but is unable to take a course at college owing to his poverty. He ...                See full summary »

36.name: The Eagle's Mate
36.description: A young girl, Anemone ( Mary Pickford ), who lives with her Aunt ( Ida Waterman ) is abducted by a crude family of Virginia mountain moonshiners. A fight between two of the young male ...                See full summary »

37.name: Mrs. Black Is Back
37.description: Mrs. Black, formerly a plump and good-natured widow, tells Professor Black, her newly-made husband, whom she adores and fears, that she is twenty-nine, instead of thirty-six, her real age, ...                See full summary »

38.name: The Patchwork Girl of Oz

39.name: What's His Name
39.description: Soda jerk Harvey is the most popular man in Blakeville NY and deliriously happy through three years of poverty-stricken marriage to Nellie. After a musical comedy troupe comes through ...                See full summary »

40.name: La donna nuda

41.name: Der Hund von Baskerville
41.description: In this early version the classic "Hound of the Baskervilles" mystery is faithfully adapted, although Watson's character is absent. Holmes' foe is called Stapleton and he menaces Holmes' client Lord Henry and his fiancée, Laura Lyons.

42.name: Hearts Adrift

43.name: Manon Lescaut

45.name: Samson
45.description: Manoah and his wife mourn deeply because both have passed the middle age mark and yet they are childless. As they become older their sorrow increases until one day the old wife calls upon ...                See full synopsis »

46.name: Salomy Jane
46.description: The story opens with the arrival in Hangtown of Madison Clay and his daughter, Salomy Jane, who have emigrated all the way from Kentucky. Straightway the young men and bachelors of the camp...                See full summary »

47.name: Mrs. Wiggs of the Cabbage Patch
47.description: Mrs. Wiggs, a loving mother whose husband has abandoned her, supports her many children and lives in hope of her husband's return.

49.name: The Ghost Breaker
